Authors:
Chanokned Senwanna, Sinang Hongsanan, Kevin D Hyde,
Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon, Sirinapa - Konta, Yong Wang
Title:
First report of the sexual morph of Pseudofusicoccum with P.
adansoniae on Para rubber
Keywords: Morphology, New sexual record, Phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Pseudofusicoccum species were collected from branches and
twigs of Hevea brasilliensis in Phayao Province, northern Thailand.
Pseudofusicoccum adansoniae and P. ardesiacum were identified and are
new records for Hevea brasilliensis. Pseudofusicoccum is known only by
its asexual morph. Here, we provide the sexual morph for
Pseudofusicoccum adansoniae. The sexual morph is characterized by
immersed, multiloculate ascomata, cylindric-clavate asci with long
pedicel, well-developed ocular chamber and short clavate, hyaline,
aseptate ascospores, covered with a persistent mucus. The sexual and
asexual connection of P. adansoniae is confirmed by phylogenetic
analyses of a combined ITS, LSU, TEF1 and Î²-tubulin dataset.
Descriptions, illustrations and molecular data are provided for the
taxa.
